page.title: 03The M.L.O.(continued)
page.content: sorted into{4}main areas by the{ {Pre-sorter}which 'reads' the lower line of dots by an{ultra-violet light. The{Automatic Sorting Machine}sorts into towns. At the destination town the upper row of dots is 'read' and sorted into streets. The Pre-sorter handles{24 000 letters}per hour and the ASM{16 000}per hour. The letters are then bagged and taken to the station. Local letters are sorted and delivered by van or bicycle. The{ {Engineering Manager}is in charge of the MLO machinery. He is in charge of ll engineers who work a 4 shift rota. Electronic breakdown is rare and mechanical breaks are usually easily mended. The{Postal Manager}is in charge of the MLO. Security is very important. Undelivered letters have to be checked carefully and returned to the sender.{Post-codes}are important.
